SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 6th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT
(a) British Front. On the SOMME front we are in touch with the French north of LANCHY, and hold MONCHY-LAGAGHE, BOUVANCOURT, and the BOIS DE BUIRE.
There is no change on the rest of the front.
(b) French Front. On the French front east of the SOMME the line runs north of LANCHY, MATIGNY (inclusive), OFFOY (inclusive).
South of the SOMME the French hold VILLETTE, LEPLESSIS, GUIVRY, CAILLOUEL, ABBECOURT.
North of the AILETTE RIVER the French are reported to have occupied the Hindenburg line east of LANDRICOURT.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
6th September, 1918.
Issued at 6-20 p.m.
